snippet: The arrest of several presidential aides in a case involving accusations of illegal surveillance of citizens has given the opposition an opening ahead of parliamentary elections on Wednesday.
abstract: Unfolding political scandal ahead of South Korea's parliamentary elections has raised questions about how much Pres Lee Myung-bak knew about the illicit surveillance of public officials and the ensuing cover-up, which has resulted in the arrest of several people closely connected to Lee.
lead_paragraph: The arrest of several presidential aides in a case involving accusations of illegal surveillance of citizens has given the opposition an opening ahead of parliamentary elections on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Spying Scandal Is Called South Korea’s Watergate
headline.main: In South Korea Scandal, Echoes of Watergate
headline.print_headline: In South Korea Scandal, Echoes of Watergate

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
